TopicTitle: Can someone finish this jimmy hinge?

Articles.Content:
Im building a JCSAT-16 replica with jimmy hinge girders for the dishes. Ive gotten it mostly done, but need help finishing it.

image of progress: http://imgur.com/a/nYxFn

.craft file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/zl9g1nhld541k81/JCSAT-16.craft?dl=0

 

thanks!

Just now, DarthVader said:

Im building a JCSAT-16 replica with jimmy hinge girders for the dishes. Ive gotten it mostly done, but need help finishing it.

image of progress: http://imgur.com/a/nYxFn

Whats a Jimmy hinge?

14 hours ago, Majorjim! said:

Whats a Jimmy hinge?

Hah, very funny. Thanks for gracing my humble thread with your presence!

Just now, DarthVader said:

Hah, very funny. Thanks for gracing my humble thread with your presence!

Looking at the pic again I see my thermo hinges! So you mean a Majorjim hinge? lol, sorry..

 What exactly cannot you get to work man?

11 minutes ago, Majorjim! said:

Looking at the pic again I see my thermo hinges! So you mean a Majorjim hinge? lol, sorry..

 What exactly cannot you get to work man?

I don't know how to proceed from what I have so far, I just grabbed your hinges from your .craft on KerbalX.

Just now, DarthVader said:

I don't know how to proceed from what I have so far, I just grabbed your hinges from your .craft on KerbalX.

I will have a look this afternoon man.

1 hour ago, DarthVader said:

I don't know how to proceed

Hey man. Ok I don't really have time to make this as I am busy today. I can walk you through the process though.

 The idea of the hinge is to have one moving part and one static part. Either the thermometer cage can move or the antenna central part. You probably want the central part alone to move.

So you need to build the cage onto the bottom structural panel. Make sure its not going to get in the way of the moving parts. Now the side panels need to become separate parts so they can move. so instead of using stack separators use docking ports to attach the panels to so you can stage them and not have any extra parts floating around. Once you have attached them to the docking port (don't surface attach it otherwise it will not disconnect, attach it to the node of the docking port).

 Then use the offset tool to move the panel into its starting position. I recommend using editor extensions redux so you can have no offset distance limits. You can do this without that but it will involve etra parts.

 Now place two antennas onto the panel you just placed, the one that will move in a position inside the thermometer cage so that when the panel disconnects they will catch inside the thermometer cage.

Now, there is no simple way to do this you have to just knuckle down and try it. If it does not work at first try to see where its getting stuck and adjust the position of the parts until it works. Done.

 If you run into any issues let me know man.
